channel.title: PotentialOfMusic.com
channel.description: Weekly Interviews of Music Educators, Musicians, Business Professionals, Non-Profit Organizations, Music Enthusiasts & more telling stories that illustrate the Potential Of Music. Hosted by Craig M. Cortello, the "Business Musician." Every day we are discovering new and exciting ways in which music and music education can influence learning, development, creativity, discipline, teamwork, success, innovation, healing, personal fulfillment, happiness, and general well-being. Join us on this journey of musical discovery!
channel.copyright: This podcast is the exclusive copyright of La Dolce Vita Enterprises, LLC. Any commercial use without express written consent is strictly prohibited. All Rights Reserved.

Weekly Interviews of Music Educators, Musicians, Business Professionals, Non-Profit Organizations, Music Enthusiasts & more telling stories that illustrate the Potential Of Music. Hosted by Craig M. Cortello, the "Business Musician." Every day we are discovering new and exciting ways in which music and music education can influence learning, development, creativity, discipline, teamwork, success, innovation, healing, personal fulfillment, happiness, and general well-being.

Join us on this journey of musical discovery!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Interviews discussing the potential of music & music education

item.title: POM #10 John Hollwitz, Fordham University
item.description:
John Hollwitz, Professor of Management Systems at Fordham University discusses an innovative approach to teamwork and collaboration used by the organization in MBA student orientation programs.
During this session, the students break out into teams and the facilitators use jazz improvisation as a means of forming cohesive groups that must work as a team and perform in a high-impact, high-energy setting.
item.itunes:author: Craig Cortello

item.title: POM #9 Stanley Jordan, State of Nature
item.description:
In 1985, Stanley Jordan's debut album "Magic Touch" sold over 500,000 copies, and his tapping technique redefined the possibilities for guitar players. Truly one of the world's elite musical talents, Jordan continued to explore unconventional recording projects and material.
In the mid-1990's he discovered the field of music therapy and approached it with the same tenacity that he applied to the guitar. Stanley has traveled the world as a spokesman for the field of music therapy and is working toward a Masters degree at Arizona State University.
He joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast to discuss the world of music therapy, music education, and his first mainstream solo album in over a decade, "State of Nature."
item.itunes:author: Craig Cortello

item.title: POM #8 Ryan O'Reilly, Snapshot Author
item.description:
Ryan O'Reilly walked away from the family business (O'Reilly Auto Parts) to pursue his passions of music and writing. A lifelong advocate of music, he quit his job, sold his house, and joined up with a band from the Austin, TX area. He worked as a band roadie, learned the business, discovered the country, and more importantly, he found himself.
Today, Ryan is a band and concert promoter with 415 Entertainment. He is also an author, with a book entitled "Snapshot" that is loosely based on his journey of discovery.
Ryan's story speaks to the power of music and the arts to act as a catalyst in allowing people to tap into their emotions and identify their unique voice in life. Ryan joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast and shares his introspective journey.

item.title: POM #7A Jimmy Robinson, Vibrating Strings
item.description:
Jimmy Robinson is one of the most talented and enduring guitar players in the New Orleans area. Long-time front man for the progressive rock band Woodenhead and the guitar-centric fusion group Twangorama, Jimmy's new solo CD "Vibtrating Strings" is a departure of sorts.
A wonderful mix of instrumental acoustic and singer-songwriter tunes flowing with emotion, "Vibrating Strings" is on the nominating ballot for a potential Grammy nomination in the Contemporary Folk/Americana category.
Jimmy joins us in studio performing 2 tracks from the album and to discuss his approach to songwriting and music.

item.title: POM #7 Dayna Steele, Rock to the Top
item.description:
For more than 20 years Dayna Steele thrived as one of the most influential and respected Rock and Roll DJ's in the U.S. Her tireless energy made her an icon in the Houston market and her fans became known as "Steeleworkers."
Dayna's success has carried over to the business world, from startup companies to voiceovers, and speaking engagements, Dayna is always breaking new ground. Her new book "Rock to the Top: What I Learned About Success from the World's Greatest Rock Stars" chronicles the lessons she learned from the rock stars that outlasted the "One-hit Wonders." (Foreword by Gene Simmons of KISS).
Dayna joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast to share those lessons (and a few behind the scenes stories) with our listeners.

item.title: POM #6 Michael Gold, Jazz Impact Workshop
item.description:
Dr. Michael Gold conducts his "Jazz Impact" workshop for corporate audiences all over the world. An upright bass player with a Phd. in jazz studies, Dr. Gold also once served as the Vice-President of Operations for a financial services firm. His unique mix of experience provides the foundation for this dynamic presentation.
During the workshop, Dr. Gold performs with world-class jazz musicians and then discusses the lessons of the dynamics of a jazz improvisational combo that can be applied to business. He joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast to discuss his workshop and those lessons that transcend music.

item.title: POM #5 Melody Gardot, Verve Records Recording Artist
item.description:
Featured on CNN and NPR, Melody Gardot recovered from a devastating accident in which she was struck by an SUV while riding a bike at the age of 19. Melody turned to music therapy as a last resort and alternative to pain medication that made her ill, and 4 years later she is a critically acclaimed recording artist, touring the world promoting her debut album.
Melody joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast to discuss her amazing story.

item.title: POM #4 Irma Thomas, Grammy Award-Winning Artist
item.description: Irma Thomas, known locally in New Orleans as the "Soul Queen of New Orleans" received her first Grammy award in 2007 on her third nomination after nearly 50 years in the music business. Irma joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast to discuss her career, the Grammy win, lessons in perserverance, and her new album "Simply Grand"

item.title: POM #3 Bob Dorough of Schoolhouse Rock
item.description:
Bob Dorough, Music Director of the Emmy-award winning animated children's educational series Schoolhouse Rock joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast.
The composer of such classics as "Conjunction Junction" and "Three is a Magic Number" discusses the genesis and evolution of the series, and future plans for new features.

item.title: POM #2 Karen Nisenson of non-profit Arts for Healing
item.description:
Karen Nisenson, Executive Director & Founder of non-profit Arts for Healing joins the PotentialOfMusic.com podcast. The organization uses music and arts therapy to reach people with developmental disabilities such as autism, down syndrome, and Alzheimers.
Karen discusses examples of how music therapy is used in a typical session.

item.title: POM #1 Dave Wish of non-profit Little Kids Rock
item.description: Founder & Executive Director of the non-profit organization "Little Kids Rock" discusses the evolution of his extra-curricular music class into an organization serving 20,000 kids in 10 states and 18 cities.
item.itunes:author: Craig Cortello
